author: Mr__Thrawn
title: Easily the Best of the LEGO Films
review:
The LEGO Movie, the 2014 animated film directed by acclaimed duo Phil Lord and Chris Miller, was a surprise critical and box-office hit. Its universal themes and humor, coupled with the massive roster of celebrity voice actors, proved a winning formula. The dedication to craft is impressive: every sequence, barring the live-action ones, is animated using entirely existing LEGO bricks. The cast is great too: Chris Pratt, Elizabeth Banks, Community's Alison Brie, Charlie Day, Will Arnett, Nick Offerman of Parks and Recreation, Will Ferrell, and even Morgan Freeman appear in major roles. Channing Tatum and Jonah Hill have cameos as well, a nod to Lord/Miller's 21 Jump Street. The score by Mark Mothersbaugh is fitting and catchy, and who can forget "Everything is Awesome" (no one can. We want to but we can't.) The movie is a lot of fun to watch again and again; definitely worth owning.

The Blu-Ray and DVD transfers look good, and the special features are mostly fine. I quite like the commentary track, though. It's quite comprehensive and features the directors and starring cast (minus Morgan Freeman). The animated shorts are okay, nothing too special, except for the truly excellent Michelangelo and Lincoln: History Cops. 
 

This Blu-Ray can be obtained for a few dollars at various retailers, and, as previously stated, I think it's a must-have for any LEGO fan.
